content.raw:
Probably it is not essential, but it would be nice to be able to specify the location of a eigen installed in non-canonical location using the `Eigen3_DIR` variable as documented in the official Eigen documentation https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox/TopicCMakeGuide.html .
A way of doing this would be to add a `find_package (Eigen3 NO_MODULE)` at the beginning of this script, and guard the rest of the logic on `if(NOT TARGET Eigen3::Eigen)` checks. 

This would also have the nice side-effect to avoid confusion on case insensitive file systems (such as macOS, unless something changed recently). On those platforms, `find_package(Eigen3)` would resolve to this script or to the official `Eigen3Config.cmake` depending on whether `find_package(ignition-cmake*)` have been called or not.
